Reviews.Title: “good for good price”
Reviews.Author: Marti11
Reviews.Content: for small budgets you get an very nice stay in Rome.You have clean rooms and find all basic things

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: leo0pard
Reviews.Content: The owner was very nice and helpful, and spoke excellent English. The room was cheap and clean, and was also in a great location. I walked every where I wanted to go, and if you aren't a fan of walking, its only a few minutes away from the bus and train station. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hostel Experience”
Reviews.Author: cengland24
Reviews.Content: The Cressy is a small but very well-maintained hostel that far exceeded my expectations. It is close to Termini (the central train/metro/bus station) so is easy for tourists to get out sight-seeing or to grab a quick and easy breakfast, which is not provided by the hostel. The rooms are a decent size, well appointed without being cramped and very clean and I was pleasantly surprised to find my bed made up each day (towels were not replaced but that's fine by me). Toilets were also kept very clean. The staff were lovely - very helpful and friendly. One thing that I did find difficult were the locks on the doors so be sure you check ensure it's locked before heading out.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Andercander
Reviews.Content: For 50 euro a night in Rome... this place is great! 5 minutes from the train and bus station. Great, fast wifi connection and a room with a view! It's an alley, but because we're on the 5th floor it's actually quite a nice outlook. My only complaint about this place is that the other guests spend too much time in the bathroom! There are two, and every time I want to go, someone is in there having a long, leisurely shower. Well, my other complaint might be that the bedsprings are squeaky and the bed could probably use replacing, but overall not bad. Check my blog for photos... www.livingmylifeinreverse.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great localization & cheap”
Reviews.Author: tmrpsi
Reviews.Content: The place is simple but clean and quite. There is no breakfast, but the internet is free. For 3 days stays is OK. The location is excellent and staff is very nice, in specially Renata, a great girl. Our problem was with the people from Rome in general. They are so stupid and are not prepared to receive tourists yet, although the city to be amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: swissworld
Reviews.Content: Dont be fooled by the entrace to the hotel or the reception. The place is small, clean, the beds are comfy and the restroom are also very clean. There is a nice size grocery store downstairs and the guy who runs that is super friendly and has about everything you can imagine. The place has no AC so I am sure in the middle of the summer not a great choise, but they do have soundproofing windows and they are as quiet as can be.

Reviews.Title: “il Dumpo...”
Reviews.Author: Chaddy65
Reviews.Content: First impressions? Well let's start with the lift up to the apartment. What a dinosaur!!! And a shower that sprays more water on the ceiling than out of the shower head?! WTF? The people there were helpful but €70 a night for a couple for this joint is way over the top. Sorry but I can't recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer1601
Reviews.Content: We stayed for seven night in Cressy. The room was clean when we arrived. Everyday we got new towels. The staff was nice and helpfull. With open windows it was a little bit noisy in the evening and the morning and you will wake up early because of the light. Just close the screens/shutters and it will be okay. A good choice if you want to stay in the center of Rome, even for a longer stay then usual.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: louise_blue7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Cressy for 5 days and 4 nights. The location is easy to find. The hotel is clean and tidy. If you are looking for an affordable hotel, i think the hotel is your best option because it's not too far from termini, have a nearby restaurants and internet cafes everything is nearby. Great location, really! Staff wise, they are very friendly, special mention to Roberto, thank you very much for suggesting places where to go and giving us directions. If i'll ever go back to Rome again, i'll definitely go back to the Cressy. Maraming salamat sa'yo Roberto. Sa muli nating pagkikita (i'll see you again soon) hehehe. ---the 3 girls from England/Philippines (March 2008)

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: benjinjapan
Reviews.Content: Like most people we left things late to book accommodation. I was a little apprehensive, but i had no need for concern. The most important thing was the location and being so close to termini station took the stress out of the arrival process, with just a short walk from the station. From there the hostel is a good walk, train or bus ride through to the main tourist areas, yet central between the colosseum and the old city. The area is very safe and a good selection of interesting cuisine close by. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms are quite new and well maintained. We stayed in a dorm to start, then moved to a twin which was quite spacious. The staff very friendly, it almost felt like you were staying with friends. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “perfect for active travel”
Reviews.Author: sstrlt121
Reviews.Content: This hotel's net value was perfect - a key area of Rome, right next to the train station, and from where you can go anywhere in Rome or even Italy (the city and touristic buses leave from the station as well.) If you're looking for luxury or a good social scene this isn't it...even though i met some really awesome people in the same room as i was in. The staff were really nice and helpful too, (of course that could be because I am charming and speak Italian), but they speak English as well.. Next time I'm in Rome, I will be here.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but no scares either”
Reviews.Author: LeithySuburbs
Reviews.Content: As other reviews have said, this is basic accomodation for the budget traveller. Pros:- 1. cheap 2. clean 3. convenient for bus and train station 4. security - 3 locked doors between you and outside (room, property entrance, main street entrance) Cons:- 1. location is not great - there are a number of dodgy looking characters around, although we never felt threatened. - lack of good restaurants in area - not really in the heart of Rome 2. our room rate was not so cheap that a few extras would have gone amiss - TV, shampoo, 2 reading lights instead of 1... 3. no AC - would make this hotel probably a bit uncomfortable in July and August, although we did have a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base to explore Rome.”
Reviews.Author: aberkmf
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Cressy at 1:30 am due to flight times and we found Roberto waiting to show us to our room and to give us advice about sightseeing, pizzerias and pickpockets - very helpful! (I had emailed and called in advance to inform them of our arrival time because it was so late). The hotel occupies the fifth floor of a fairly grotty looking building. However, we were pleasantly surprised when the door to Cressy opened to reveal a fresh and clean reception area. There is a lift but you have to make sure that you shut both sets of doors or the lift won't move. We only had one day where somebody had left one door open so we had to walk down rather than use the lift. We paid for our stay upon arrival (we could have paid afterwards if we'd liked) in cash (no choice about that). We were a group of three friends who stayed in a room with a private bathroom. I would advise people travelling in groups to pay a bit extra for a private bathroom so that they could be up and out before the heat made it uncomfortable to go walking. Our room was larger than expected, clean and behind 3 locked doors (door to building, door to Cressy and then room door). This fully met all of our requirements as the purpose of our holiday was to explore Rome, see the sights and then sleep in a hotel room that was safe and relatively quiet. The only noise we had was the traffic. We slept with the window open on the first night but the traffic noise was horrific so we resorted to closing the window and having the fan on. Location is fantastic! We walked everywhere apart from to the Vatican (we walked back from there) and saw all the sights we wanted to in the 5 days we were in Rome. We would definitely stay there again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, perfect for a budget visit to the city.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Coming in from the street, this "albergo" (hotel) seemed rather sketchy. But after buzzing in and becoming more comfortable with the safety of the place (3 separate locked doors to get to a room), the place was a lot more pleasant. The young guy that worked there was incredible, giving us the lay of the city and telling us what to watch out for, even suggesting some reasonably cheap places to eat. The room was nothing incredible (we were in a room without a bathroom), but it did have a mirror and a sink which was good. The shared bathroom was nothing especially beautiful but was kept fairly clean and was working perfectly. The location nearby Termini was for us backpackers a blessing, letting us unload quickly after getting of the train. There is no sign out front, but you can look for Pensione Catherine (it shares the same building). Rome isn't as huge as it looks on the map, so although the hotel looks like it's out of the way, you can hoof it to the other side of the city (Vatican) within an hour. Less than a block away on the opposite side of the street is an incredible internet/phone cafe that was ridiculously cheap (a euro an hour for internet - you can even pay by minute/page - and ten cents a minute to call home to Canada).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: dandyUK40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Cressy for a long weeekend in March 2006. On arriving at the hotel we recieved a warm welcome and were orienated to the city by being talked through a map of the sights. We had booked a double room wih an ensuite bathroom. The room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. The location was great for our short stay and the price really good too. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others looking for somewhere with all the basic necessities, somewhere that is really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Cressy Hotel - clean, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a family group (2 adults and a teenager) and stayed at the Cressy Hotel in September. I would highly recommend this Pensione. Clean, friendly and very convenient. It is located a very short walk from the terimini train, metro and bus station. You really can walk to all the big tourist sites except the Vatican which is short local bus ride. The street is full of cafes and resturants and laundettes and on the weekend there are vege and clothing markets outside your door. Roberto our Host was wonderful. Roberto speaks excellent English if your Italian is not so good. Roberto had maps and advise on local buses and places that were 'must see' and cafes and wine and where to be careful of pick pockets and all those bits of local knowledge that enriched our stay in Rome. We all threw coins in the Trevi fountain (very corny I know) and wished to return to Rome again - and would stay at the Cressy again.

HotelInfo.Name: Cressy
HotelInfo.Address: Via Volturno 27, 00185 Rome, Italy
